phone-number-id.description: Phone Number ID. Obtainable through the app dashboard.
phone-number-id.title: Phone Number ID

to.description: The number of the recipient you are sending the message to
to.title: Recipient Phone Number

recipient-wa-id.description: The WhatsApp ID of the recipient. Most likely the same with their phone number.
recipient-wa-id.title: Recipient WhatsApp ID

message-status.description: The status of the message. It is not always available. Example: when sending authentication template, it won't show up.
message-status.title: Message Status

TASK_SEND_TEMPLATE.instillShortDescription: Send template. Support all template types except product/catalog-based template. For more information: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates

header-type.description: Specify the parameter type for the header section of the template. If there is no header section, pick none. If there is, select one and fill out the Header Parameters.
header-type.title: Header Type

language-code.description: The code of the language or locale to use. Supported languages: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/messages/message-templates#supported-languages
language-code.title: Language Code

header-parameters.description: Specify the parameters for the header section of the template. If the header is a 'text', just create a normal string array (if there is no parameter, leave it blank). If the header is an 'image' or a 'video', the array format will be [the ID or link of the media]. If the header is a 'document', the array format will be [the ID or link of the document, file name to be displayed in WhatsApp (optional)]. If the header is a 'location', the array format will be [latitude, longitude, name, address]. Please make sure that it has 'http' in the url if you use link as the parameter.
header-parameters.title: Header Parameters

body-parameters.description: Specify the parameters for the body section of the template. Leave this blank if there is no parameter.
body-parameters.title: Body Parameters

button-parameters.description: Specify the parameters for button(s). Leave this blank if there is no parameter. Follow this format or it won't work: parameter_type;value_of_the_parameter. The seperator is a semicolon. Example: quick_reply;randomvalue. Note: This button parameter only support two types 'quick_reply' and 'url'
button-parameters.title: Button Parameters
